author: COMSOL
description: A modern high-power industrial fiber laser system can deliver up to 3Â kW of single-mode laser radiation on to surfaces to be cut, drilled, welded or marked. Even using highly transmissive materials, the optical component used to focus the laser beam onto target surfaces can be affected by the large amount of power carried by the light. As the laser beam passes through the optical components, thermal expansion as well as variation of the refractive index of the optical materials can change the system's focus. This example computes the focal shift in a high-powered laser system due to thermal deformation.
label: thermally_induced_focal_shift.mph
